description.narrative: Government at national and district-level has increased capacity and accountability mechanisms for child rights-based planning, policy formulation, budgeting and reporting by December 2016

sector.narrative: Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Data, research, M&E, and use of evidence on children with disabilities

description.narrative: Other General Services support to civil society
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Malawi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Malawi Country Programme Document 2012-2016 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Malawi 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Malawi Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government at national and district-level has increased capacity and accountability mechanisms for child rights-based planning, policy formulation, budgeting and reporting by December 2016

description.narrative: Capacities of Parliament, Ministry of Finance, National Statistical Office and selected Districts Councils have been strengthened to improve fiscal transparency, measure child poverty and effectively budget for children through evidence generation, policy and budget advocacy and technical assistance from UNICEF. | Status:Met | As-of Date:26/12/2018

title.narrative: Share of public investments in non-contributory social protection programmes in real per capita terms
Child poverty is routinely measured and reported by the government
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Partnership/collaboration for policy advocacy for children is established with civic society, NGOs/CSOs, private sector or Parliament Committees
1.4 Policies and programmes are influenced by analysis and advocacy to reduce child poverty
